fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Advances in Low dimensional and Quantum topology
fields.Conference Location: University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA, USA
fields.Description/Abstract:
It is still an open problem to decide when each (oriented) link in an oriented 3-manifold has a finite skein tree of Conway resolutions with all leaves in a set of standard links. Here we define a set of standard links by
choosing one isotopy class of links within each homotopy class of links. In hyperbolic 3-manifolds a natural standard set of links can be constructed from the set of primitive geodesics (with base points and framings).
Then each link within sufficiently small Hausdorff distance to a link in a specific subset of standard links has a finite skein tree. We will discuss some ideas how length function and link characteristic can be used to
define complexity functions, which might be useful in proving the existence of finite skein trees in more general cases.
